feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days, requiring manual interventions for tracking overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation exists.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a greyed-out formula in the leave policy that is overridden by the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Count in EOS Gratuity Calculator
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations. The system requires enhancement to automatically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy Between System and Manual Gratuity Calculations
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with support explaining the system calculation follows a specific formula based on service duration and daily wage
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation uses specific tiered rates and prorated calculations that may not match manual estimates
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation method leading to admin confusion

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th) when computing total service duration. The calculation method can result in a slight difference in total days worked (912 vs 913 days), impacting the final gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion is not transparently handled in service duration calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The system uses a fixed divisor of 30 days for daily wage calculation, which may not align with all client expectations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor inconsistency in counting total service days
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential discrepancy in days calculation method for gratuity computation

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The specific case showed a discrepancy where the daily wage was divided differently than the user expected (31 vs 30 days), resulting in a salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days affect daily wage calculations, causing accrual amount variations
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with different working day counts.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Misinterpreted Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic error in handling salary proration for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Reference in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction is mathematically correct, but the displayed daily rate in remarks is inconsistent with calendar days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides individual policy-level leave calculation settings. System calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate instead of policy-specific basic salary / working days method.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is calculated based on a fixed 26 working days per month (313 working days annually), with no automatic pro-rata adjustments.
limitations.impact: Manual tracking required for overtime and unpaid leaves

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Leave policy formulas for daily wage are greyed out and cannot be edited when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Timing Sensitivity in Salary Configuration Updates
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Inflexible Leap Year Handling in Service Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals across all employee calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements

limitations.title: Leave Days Not Prorated for Mid-Month Departures
limitations.limitation_statement: Monthly accrual policy does not include leave days for incomplete months, requiring manual adjustment for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month will not automatically receive prorated leave balance in End of Service (EOS) calculation

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Rigid Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden, potentially causing discrepancies between system calculations and user expectations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method or adjust for specific month lengths

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impact monthly accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Users must choose between a dynamic working days method that varies monthly or a custom days method for consistent calculations

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies and manual intervention required to standardize daily wage calculations

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ based on unique work week setups

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future
limitations.impact: Potential overpayment or incorrect salary calculations for offboarded employees

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are deleted or modified
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations

limitations.title: No Automatic Retroactive Adjustments
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions after initial calculation, even when public holidays are added late
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for calculation discrepancies

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days
limitations.impact: Deductions may slightly exceed expected monthly salary amount

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must account for varying days in different months, especially February in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential misunderstanding of daily rate calculations if users only view remarks without checking actual deduction

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically adjust salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current system lacks automated proration mechanism
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually track overtime and unpaid leaves per employee, using a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in daily wage formula between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings use (basic salary + allowances)/number of days, while leave policy may show a different formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings, which takes precedence for unpaid leave calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in total service days calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System incorrectly using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap year
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust calculation to include 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of service calculations show incorrect pro-rated amounts
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and potentially adjust calculated amounts

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation between system and manual methods
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Specific calculation method using tiered rates: 21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years, with prorated calculation for partial years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance or use conditional accrual policy for daily leave accrual

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in total service days and resulting gratuity amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Uncertainty in counting service days, particularly around leap year and departure date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation by counting exact days and confirming leap year day inclusion

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in leave salary amount calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses predefined policy configuration for daily rate divisor, which may not match user's manual calculation expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy settings and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the computed amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Cumulative leave salary amounts differ unexpectedly between months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting in leave encashment configuration for more consistent calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week and confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System's proration logic does not account for departure dates relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked (e.g., 21,000/30 * 15 days = AED 10,500)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automatic synchronization between leave management and payroll systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually review and remove orphaned deductions; contact system administrator for backend cleanup

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect salary deduction due to public holiday calculation mismatch
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing difference in public holiday addition between leave request and payroll calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually add deduction to correct the calculation discrepancy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), then multiplying by leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42 days divisor used in calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses correct backend calculation but displays incorrect days in remarks
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount against displayed daily rate, focusing on backend calculation accuracy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions during unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific calculation methods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate configuration and understand its precedence over policy-level settings

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate displayed does not match leave occurrence month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on payroll processing month instead of storing original leave occurrence month rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The specific case showed a discrepancy where the daily wage was divided differently than the user expected (31 vs 30 days), resulting in a salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations, causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Misinterpreted Working Days Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Reference in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction is mathematically correct, but the displayed daily rate in remarks is inconsistent with calendar days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Global daily rate configuration overrides individual policy-level leave calculation settings. System calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate instead of policy-specific basic salary / working days method.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is calculated based on a fixed 26 working days per month (313 working days annually), with no automatic pro-rata adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Timing Sensitivity in Salary Configuration Updates
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leap Year Handling in Service Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals across all employee calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Days Not Prorated for Mid-Month Departures
claims_to_validate.statement: Monthly accrual policy does not include leave days for incomplete months, requiring manual adjustment for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Rigid Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden, potentially causing discrepancies between system calculations and user expectations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impact monthly accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are deleted or modified

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: No Automatic Retroactive Adjustments
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate salary deductions after initial calculation, even when public holidays are added late

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations must account for varying days in different months, especially February in leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
